instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON – CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesn’t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .
definitions.U4900: What is U4900? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in older(pre-2013) macbooks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only starting without screen attached
threads.message: This <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> had waterdamage and wont start. I cleaned that and now it only starts if there is no monitor attached to it (internal and external). It i plug any monitor in fan just twitch once every time i press the power button. Without a screen it chimes but turns off after ~20 seconds. It beeps without ram and also stays on beeping forewer without ram (not turning off like it does with ram - i tested every combination of the two sticks in both slots and also one of mine - everytime with the same result.). If i "trick" it by starting it and instantly plugging in a external monitor after it chimed it shows a white screen but turns off same way as if there is no screen at all. I tested a known good LCD and it still wont start with the LCD connected. I measured all Pins of J9000 in diode mode and compared it betreen screen plugged in, screen unplugged and  a working board (with screen plugged in and also unplugged) and i cant find any differences. So i am stuck.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only starting without screen attached
threads.message: Check if <RESISTOR>R7403</RESISTOR> OK?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only starting without screen attached
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7403</RESISTOR> = 181,7 kOhm (should be 182 kOhm), there was no Corrosion in that area.
<RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> is also exact 150,0 kOhm as it should be

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only starting without screen attached
threads.message:
Seems thatb turns off only when AXG voltage is enabled.
Check for corroded traces, or components (resistor maybe) on CPU area...
Also try to start in SMC bypass mode...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only starting without screen attached
threads.message:
There is not really any corrosion on the cpu Side. It was just a little bit near <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> and J4510 aswell as j3502
SMC Bypass did not help aswell

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only starting without screen attached
threads.message:
Your symptom points to AXG issue.
If fails to start even with (only) external monitor...

Try new BIOS, just in case.
You can also try removing <TRANSISTOR>Q3880</TRANSISTOR>; only internal LCD available then.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only starting without screen attached
threads.message:
I have no board with bios on it here today. I?ill swap bios an monday (saying the original one). 
Could i also remove one of these instead of <TRANSISTOR>Q3880</TRANSISTOR>: <RESISTOR>R3881</RESISTOR> or <TRANSISTOR>Q3805</TRANSISTOR> or <DIODE>D3895</DIODE>? This should also stop thunderbold from working and would be easier to replace...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only starting without screen attached
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R3881</RESISTOR>, or <TRANSISTOR>Q3805</TRANSISTOR> disable TBT too.

Do not swap the BIOS chip, reflash with new clean ME file.
I suppose can be found on the forum...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only starting without screen attached
threads.message:
As i want to disable thunderbold i want to check the voltage that <CHIP>U3890</CHIP> prodces before i remove <RESISTOR>R3881</RESISTOR> and after to make sure TBT is disabled. I measured without LCD and there are just 2,5 V at <DIODE>D3890</DIODE> (both sides - diode mode measurement > 0,5 V at both sides - no short). That should be 12.6 V (if not boosting) or 0 V if i am right. Also i would expect it to be 0 V with <RESISTOR>R3881</RESISTOR> removed. With <RESISTOR>R3881</RESISTOR> back in place i get 12,6 V at the top of the voltage divider, 8,4 V at <SIGNAL>TBT_DIV_L</SIGNAL> and ~6 V at Pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R3881</RESISTOR> (i expected that to be 0 V). So i came to <TRANSISTOR>Q3805</TRANSISTOR> and the enable is 0 V. To be sure i am not out of mind here i removed <TRANSISTOR>Q3880</TRANSISTOR> (as you suggested) and i still get 2,5 V at <SIGNAL>PPVIN_SW_T29BST</SIGNAL> and i cant understand where that voltage is coming from... But also with <TRANSISTOR>Q3881</TRANSISTOR> removed board wont start with lcd plugged in...
Also i wrote down all parts that had corrosion on them as i got the board. Heres the list maybe that helps.


<CHIP>U3890</CHIP>
<TRANSISTOR>Q5480</TRANSISTOR>
<CHIP>U4900</CHIP>
<RESISTOR>R2570</RESISTOR>
<DIODE>D9498</DIODE>
<CHIP>U7542</CHIP>
<CHIP>U4582</CHIP>
<CHIP>U5701</CHIP>
<CHIP>U7200</CHIP>


<CHIP>U3890</CHIP> is one of them. The corrosion was in the area of pins 1-10... <RESISTOR>R3889</RESISTOR> and the traces to <CHIP>U3890</CHIP> are fine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only starting without screen attached
threads.message: I tested with a clean bios today but still the same behaviour. I am not sure but as far as i understand it couod be a TBT issue as the Voltage at <DIODE>D3895</DIODE> is not correct. Should i try a new <CHIP>U3890</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only starting without screen attached
threads.message: <SIGNAL>15V_T29</SIGNAL> is enabled only if an external device is detected on the thunderbolt port.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only starting without screen attached
threads.message: Even if i start it and plug in the external monitor while its on i get only 2.5 V at <DIODE>D3895</DIODE> but it shows a questionmark folder. So thunderbold is working i guess. Is there anything else i can check in a case like this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only starting without screen attached
threads.message:
Which pin of <DIODE>D3895</DIODE>?
High voltage should appear on K.
But you should get 5V on A, if <TRANSISTOR>Q3880</TRANSISTOR> is enabled...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only starting without screen attached
threads.message: I get on both sides 2.5 V at <DIODE>D3895</DIODE>. <SIGNAL>TBT_A_HV_EN</SIGNAL> is not there but at the same time i can see a question mark folder on external monitor plugged into J9400

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only starting without screen attached
threads.message: Did you reflash BIOS?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only starting without screen attached
threads.message: yes but no change unfortunately

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only starting without screen attached
threads.message: Known good working BIOS, with clean ME for sure?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only starting without screen attached
threads.message: I hope so. If you have one that is 100% sure working and it you would provide that i can try that aswell but as i get the exact same issue i guess thats not a bios thing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only starting without screen attached
threads.message:
Link already uploaded on the forum...
[url]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/44989-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-corrupt-efi-firmware[/url]
If still the same, then 100% no BIOS issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only starting without screen attached
threads.message: I tested the file from the other post you linked me to but still the exact same issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only starting without screen attached
threads.message:
Recharge original BIOS, as is not BIOS issue.

So machine doesn't even start if external monitor is connected?
Do you also need to unplug LCD to start?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only starting without screen attached
threads.message: Ok i flash original Bios back. Yes, it only starts with both monitors disconnected. If there is any monitor plugged in (internal or external) fan just twitch one time. After the fan twitched i can hear a quiet "brumming" sound from the fan and can feel it vibrating until i unplug battery... Pressing power again results in no reaction (no 2nd fan twitch)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only starting without screen attached
threads.message:
Machine stays on for long time if no monitors connected?
Test it only with USB mouse and OSX pendrive, to assure stable activity

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only starting without screen attached
threads.message: Yes it stays on with everything except monitor connected (+USB mouse and pen drive). It starts, chimes and even talks to me after few seconds if i plug my Mavericks USB drive in (it has the voice over thing enabled...)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only starting without screen attached
threads.message: Is there something else i could try?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only starting without screen attached
threads.message:
This should be something related with AXG block from CPU.
Try to reflow CPU.
Check first if <RESISTOR>R7403</RESISTOR> is correct.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only starting without screen attached
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7430</RESISTOR> is correct. I gave CPU a reflow same way i do with 2011 MBP/iMac GPU issues to test if its really a GPU problem but that did not change anything aswell...
So i think its time to give up here...
